resources.string: Switch the internal and the external sdcard on your device. Use at your own risk (even if...) You can use the app with almost every devices. Carefully locate the external and internal folder and your external sdcard device and update the settings (it will spread rainbow pony all over the world).
* it will stay until you reboot the phone
** At boot, the application will execute the copy, no init.d support required!\n

Application by codlab ( @codlab or http://twitter.com/codlab).
 Source code available on github : http://github.com/codlab/android_internal_external /
 Check my application on the market : https://play.google.com/store/apps/developer?id=codlab
 Original script by mattiadj from xda.
 Original thread :http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1772234
Make a donation via the Google Play inapp purchase
Open the invite to make a donation
Redirects you to the paypal website
You can contact me at codlabtech@gmail.com
The access to the original ext. block
It seems you did not choose a configuretion. Press ok to open the settings
The file has been download to /data/codlab_int2ext
Sent when the swap is done
The mount result was incorrect. Error with su?
The list will be send to codlab / codlabtech@gmail.com
the build.prop will be used to target the conf
Click here to see all the different devices and fs
You can\'t uncheck a rom configuration!
Warning : you changed the settings, you have to refresh the External > Internal, boot etc...
You can contribute to this app by making a simple play-store in app donation
Thanks for having purchased a donation
Thanks for having purchased a donation

0/ -- This little text will help find your different data. Note that on some system you will need more tricky ones but they are rare ;)

 1/ -- First of all, you will need to format your sdcard to exfat (for instance), ext4 is also good - avoid fat32 cause on new Android versions, due to security enhanced, rights on folder/file are checked and... its better ;)

 2/ -- Then when you are good with this step. Go to the settings. Use the last option "VIEW THE DIFFERENT DEVICES" to display your list of points mounted.

 3/ -- You need to find the internal and the external folder which are currently used!
 The internal folder should be in a line where you see in the information something like "folder : /mnt/shell/emulated" or /mnt/shell/emulated/legacy, etc... To be sure when you find it, use a file explorer and go to this folder, if you see your internal sdcard folders, you are good to go! if not, if you see few subfolders only, navigate through them to locate the right place ;) Done?
 Now simply set it in the option "THE ORIGINAL INTERNAL MOUNTING POINT"
\ 4/ -- Ok then, for the external folder, it is.... EXACTLY the same. And to make it easier? If you formatted your sdcard to exfat... you will see a exfat in the (fs : xxx )

 5/ -- The tricky part? The external sdcard device used by the system as the point to mount! But hey, you located your folder earlier? Click on the option to set automatically the info in the textbox. Simply check it is there by editing it, do the same with the options, often umask=0000 is quite enough - if not, you can often erase everything before the allow time parameter in the textbox of the mount option.

 6/ -- Everything is okay? Check the "USE PER DEFAULT" to tell the system to use custom information
 Go to the main screen and try to swap the two folders. To check it? Go the system settings > storage. If you have trouble, note that you can reboot the device, change the settings and retry.

 7/ -- Note : you can check the "AT BOOT" checkbox only when you are sure you have the right options and you tested them!

 8/ -- Information Questions? You can contact me at codlabtech@gmail.com or cellphone (france!) +33675683928

 Want to contribute? Please make your donation via the play store in app purchase or directly through paypal.

 Want the source code? The source code is still quite in mess but available in my github repository : http://github.com/codlab
